xv6/lapic.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 // The local APIC manages internal (non-I/O) interrupts.
00002 // See Chapter 8 & Appendix C of Intel processor manual volume 3.
00003 
00004 #include "types.h"
00005 #include "defs.h"
00006 #include "traps.h"
00007 #include "mmu.h"
00008 #include "x86.h"
00009 
00010 // Local APIC registers, divided by 4 for use as uint[] indices.
00011 #define ID      (0x0020/4)   // ID
00012 #define VER     (0x0030/4)   // Version
00013 #define TPR     (0x0080/4)   // Task Priority
00014 #define EOI     (0x00B0/4)   // EOI
00015 #define SVR     (0x00F0/4)   // Spurious Interrupt Vector
00016   #define ENABLE     0x00000100   // Unit Enable
00017 #define ESR     (0x0280/4)   // Error Status
00018 #define ICRLO   (0x0300/4)   // Interrupt Command
00019   #define INIT       0x00000500   // INIT/RESET
00020   #define STARTUP    0x00000600   // Startup IPI
00021   #define DELIVS     0x00001000   // Delivery status
00022   #define ASSERT     0x00004000   // Assert interrupt (vs deassert)
00023   #define LEVEL      0x00008000   // Level triggered
00024   #define BCAST      0x00080000   // Send to all APICs, including self.
00025 #define ICRHI   (0x0310/4)   // Interrupt Command [63:32]
00026 #define TIMER   (0x0320/4)   // Local Vector Table 0 (TIMER)
00027   #define X1         0x0000000B   // divide counts by 1
00028   #define PERIODIC   0x00020000   // Periodic
00029 #define PCINT   (0x0340/4)   // Performance Counter LVT
00030 #define LINT0   (0x0350/4)   // Local Vector Table 1 (LINT0)
00031 #define LINT1   (0x0360/4)   // Local Vector Table 2 (LINT1)
00032 #define ERROR   (0x0370/4)   // Local Vector Table 3 (ERROR)
00033   #define MASKED     0x00010000   // Interrupt masked
00034 #define TICR    (0x0380/4)   // Timer Initial Count
00035 #define TCCR    (0x0390/4)   // Timer Current Count
00036 #define TDCR    (0x03E0/4)   // Timer Divide Configuration
00037 
00038 volatile uint *lapic;  // Initialized in mp.c
00039 
00040 static void
00041 lapicw(int index, int value)
00042 {
00043   lapic[index] = value;
00044   lapic[ID];  // wait for write to finish, by reading
00045 }
00046 
00047 void
00048 lapicinit(int c)
00049 {
00050   if(!lapic) 
00051     return;
00052 
00053   // Enable local APIC; set spurious interrupt vector.
00054   lapicw(SVR, ENABLE | (T_IRQ0 + IRQ_SPURIOUS));
00055 
00056   // The timer repeatedly counts down at bus frequency
00057   // from lapic[TICR] and then issues an interrupt.  
00058   // If xv6 cared more about precise timekeeping,
00059   // TICR would be calibrated using an external time source.
00060   lapicw(TDCR, X1);
00061   lapicw(TIMER, PERIODIC | (T_IRQ0 + IRQ_TIMER));
00062   lapicw(TICR, 10000000); 
00063 
00064   // Disable logical interrupt lines.
00065   lapicw(LINT0, MASKED);
00066   lapicw(LINT1, MASKED);
00067 
00068   // Disable performance counter overflow interrupts
00069   // on machines that provide that interrupt entry.
00070   if(((lapic[VER]>>16) & 0xFF) >= 4)
00071     lapicw(PCINT, MASKED);
00072 
00073   // Map error interrupt to IRQ_ERROR.
00074   lapicw(ERROR, T_IRQ0 + IRQ_ERROR);
00075 
00076   // Clear error status register (requires back-to-back writes).
00077   lapicw(ESR, 0);
00078   lapicw(ESR, 0);
00079 
00080   // Ack any outstanding interrupts.
00081   lapicw(EOI, 0);
00082 
00083   // Send an Init Level De-Assert to synchronise arbitration ID's.
00084   lapicw(ICRHI, 0);
00085   lapicw(ICRLO, BCAST | INIT | LEVEL);
00086   while(lapic[ICRLO] & DELIVS)
00087     ;
00088 
00089   // Enable interrupts on the APIC (but not on the processor).
00090   lapicw(TPR, 0);
00091 }
00092 
00093 int
00094 cpunum(void)
00095 {
00096   // Cannot call cpu when interrupts are enabled:
00097   // result not guaranteed to last long enough to be used!
00098   // Would prefer to panic but even printing is chancy here:
00099   // almost everything, including cprintf and panic, calls cpu,
00100   // often indirectly through acquire and release.
00101   if(readeflags()&FL_IF){
00102     static int n;
00103     if(n++ == 0)
00104       cprintf("cpu called from %x with interrupts enabled\n",
00105         __builtin_return_address(0));
00106   }
00107 
00108   if(lapic)
00109     return lapic[ID]>>24;
00110   return 0;
00111 }
00112 
00113 // Acknowledge interrupt.
00114 void
00115 lapiceoi(void)
00116 {
00117   if(lapic)
00118     lapicw(EOI, 0);
00119 }
00120 
00121 // Spin for a given number of microseconds.
00122 // On real hardware would want to tune this dynamically.
00123 void
00124 microdelay(int us)
00125 {
00126 }
00127 
00128 
00129 #define IO_RTC  0x70
00130 
00131 // Start additional processor running bootstrap code at addr.
00132 // See Appendix B of MultiProcessor Specification.
00133 void
00134 lapicstartap(uchar apicid, uint addr)
00135 {
00136   int i;
00137   ushort *wrv;
00138   
00139   // "The BSP must initialize CMOS shutdown code to 0AH
00140   // and the warm reset vector (DWORD based at 40:67) to point at
00141   // the AP startup code prior to the [universal startup algorithm]."
00142   outb(IO_RTC, 0xF);  // offset 0xF is shutdown code
00143   outb(IO_RTC+1, 0x0A);
00144   wrv = (ushort*)(0x40<<4 | 0x67);  // Warm reset vector
00145   wrv[0] = 0;
00146   wrv[1] = addr >> 4;
00147 
00148   // "Universal startup algorithm."
00149   // Send INIT (level-triggered) interrupt to reset other CPU.
00150   lapicw(ICRHI, apicid<<24);
00151   lapicw(ICRLO, INIT | LEVEL | ASSERT);
00152   microdelay(200);
00153   lapicw(ICRLO, INIT | LEVEL);
00154   microdelay(100);    // should be 10ms, but too slow in Bochs!
00155   
00156   // Send startup IPI (twice!) to enter bootstrap code.
00157   // Regular hardware is supposed to only accept a STARTUP
00158   // when it is in the halted state due to an INIT.  So the second
00159   // should be ignored, but it is part of the official Intel algorithm.
00160   // Bochs complains about the second one.  Too bad for Bochs.
00161   for(i = 0; i < 2; i++){
00162     lapicw(ICRHI, apicid<<24);
00163     lapicw(ICRLO, STARTUP | (addr>>12));
00164     microdelay(200);
00165   }
00166 }
